# OSPSuite R package

# Overview

The [ospsuite](https://github.com/open-systems-pharmacology/ospsuite-r)R
package provides the functionality of loading, manipulating, and running
the simulations created in the Open Systems Pharmacology Software tools
PK-Sim and MoBi.

- [Documentation](#documentation)
- [Installation](#installation)
- [Known issues](#known-issues)
- [Development](#development)
- [Code of conduct](#code-of-conduct)
- [Contribution](#contribution)
- [Licence](#licence)

# Documentation

For complete documentation, see the [online
documentation](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/).

## Essential Guides

**Essential guides:**

- [Get
  Started](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/ospsuite.html) -
  Complete beginner tutorial with working examples
- [Loading a simulation and accessing
  entities](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/load-get.html)
- [Changing parameter and molecule start
  values](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/set-values.html)
- [Running a
  simulation](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/run-simulation.html)

**For advanced workflows:**

- [Efficient
  calculations](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/efficient-calculations.html)
- [Creating
  individuals](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/create-individual.html)
- [Population
  simulations](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/create-run-population.html)
- [PK
  Analysis](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/pk-analysis.html)
- [Sensitivity
  analysis](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/sensitivity-analysis.html)

**Data handling and visualization:**

- [Working with data sets and import from
  excel](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/observed-data.html)
- [Working with `DataCombined`
  class](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/data-combined.html)
- [Visualizations with
  `DataCombined`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/data-combined-plotting.html)

**Reference:**

- [Dimensions and
  Units](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/unit-conversion.html)
- [Table
  parameters](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/table-parameters.html)
- [PK-Sim
  Installation](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/PKSim-installation.html)

# Installation

The **ospsuite** package requires R version 4.x.x and supports
[Windows](#on-windows) and [Linux (Ubuntu)](#on-linux) operating
systems.

`ospsuite` is not available on CRAN and depends on packages from the OSP
ecosystem that are not available on CRAN. Follow the instructions below
to install the package and all required dependencies.

## Pre-requisites

The [ospsuite](https://github.com/open-systems-pharmacology/ospsuite-r)
package requires
[rSharp](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/rsharp/) and its
external dependencies (Visual C++ Redistributable and .NET 8). Install
these dependencies using the following instructions:

- [For
  Windows](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/rSharp?tab=readme-ov-file#prerequisites)
- [For
  Linux](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/rSharp?tab=readme-ov-file#ubuntu)

## From GitHub (recommended)

Install the latest released version from GitHub using the
[remotes](https://remotes.r-lib.org) package. This installation method
downloads and installs all required dependencies.

``` r
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite-R@*release")
```

To install the latest development version:

``` r
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite-R")
```

## From package archive files (Deprecated)

Install manually from pre-built archive files available in the
[releases](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite-R/releases).

#### Install CRAN dependencies

Installing from archive files requires manual installation of CRAN
dependencies first.

``` r
# Install dependencies (e.g. R6) which are on CRAN
install.packages("cli")
install.packages("crayon")
install.packages("data.table")
install.packages("dplyr")
install.packages("ggplot2")
install.packages("ggtext")
install.packages("glue")
install.packages("jsonlite")
install.packages("lifecycle")
install.packages("logger")
install.packages("openxlsx")
install.packages("patchwork")
install.packages("purrr")
install.packages("R6")
install.packages("readr")
install.packages("rlang")
install.packages("showtext")
install.packages("stringi")
install.packages("stringr")
install.packages("tidyr")
install.packages("xml2")
```

#### Install non-CRAN dependencies

Pre-built packages are available as binary files (*.zip for Windows,*
.tar.gz for Linux) Download the OSPSuite-R binary archive from the
[releases
page](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite-R/releases).
Download and install these additional non-CRAN dependencies:

- [`{rSharp}`](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/rSharp/releases/latest)
- [`{ospuite.utils}`](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite.RUtils/releases/latest)
- [`{tlf}`](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/TLF-Library/releases/latest)

In [RStudio IDE](https://www.rstudio.com/), use the *Install* option in
the *Packages* pane and select *Install from -\> Package Archive File*
to install packages from binary files.

**Note**: CRAN dependencies for
[rSharp](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/rsharp/),
`{ospuite.utils}`, and
[tlf](https://github.com/open-systems-pharmacology/tlf-library) were
installed in the previous step.

``` r
# Install rSharp from local file 
# Replace pathTo_rSharp.zip with the actual path to the .zip file (or to the .tar.gz file on Linux)
install.packages(pathTo_rSharp.zip, repos = NULL)

# Install ospsuite.utils from local file
# Replace pathTo_ospsuite.utils.zip with the actual path to the .zip file (or to the .tar.gz file on Linux)
install.packages(pathTo_ospsuite.utils.zip, repos = NULL)

# Install tlf from local file
# Replace pathTo_tlf.zip with the actual path to the .zip file (or to the .tar.gz file on Linux)
install.packages(pathTo_tlf.zip, repos = NULL)

# Install ospsuite from local file
# Replace pathToOSPSuite.zip with the actual path to the .zip file (or to the .tar.gz file on Linux)
install.packages(pathTo_OSPSuite.zip, repos = NULL)
```

# Known issues

## Loading `ospsuite` might fail if the system locale is not set to English

- On Windows, set
  `Settings > Language > Administrative language settings > Current language for non-Unicode programs`
  to `English (United States)` and reboot.

- On Linux, set the environment variable `LC_ALL` to `~/.bashrc` before
  starting R:

  `export LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8`

- add the path to the lib subfolder of installed ospsuite package to
  LD_LIBRARY_PATH
  `export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/lib/R/site-library/ospsuite/lib/:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH`

## Saving and loading the workspace in RStudio does not restore objects

The ospsuite package uses the features implemented in PK-Sim and MoBi by
creating `.NET` objects (e.g. a simulation) and using them from R. These
objects cannot be saved as part of the workspace and reloaded on next
start. Upon restoring the workspace, the objects will be `NULL` and
cannot be re-used.

# Development

## Development Setup

When developing the
[ospsuite](https://github.com/open-systems-pharmacology/ospsuite-r)
package, you need to prepare platform-specific library files before
using
[`devtools::load_all()`](https://devtools.r-lib.org/reference/load_all.html).
The package uses configure scripts during installation to rename
platform-specific DLLs, but
[`devtools::load_all()`](https://devtools.r-lib.org/reference/load_all.html)
bypasses this process.

**Run the development setup script:**

``` r
source("tools/setup_dev.R")
setup_dev()
```

**When to run `setup_dev()`:** - After cloning the repository for the
first time - After switching to a different branch - After pulling
changes that might affect library files

The script automatically detects your operating system and renames the
appropriate DLL: - **Windows**: Renames
`System.Data.SQLite.windows_linux.dll` → `System.Data.SQLite.dll` -
**Linux**: Renames `System.Data.SQLite.windows_linux.dll` →
`System.Data.SQLite.dll` - **macOS**: Renames
`System.Data.SQLite.mac.dll` → `System.Data.SQLite.dll`

## Embedded binaries

The [ospsuite](https://github.com/open-systems-pharmacology/ospsuite-r)
package requires shared libraries to access PK-Sim functionality. To
obtain the latest libraries (**.dll** on Windows or **.so** on Linux),
run the `update_core_files.R` script included with this package.

Because
[ospsuite](https://github.com/open-systems-pharmacology/ospsuite-r)
contains binary files, it is classified as a binary package and cannot
be submitted to CRAN.

## Versioning

The package follows the versioning process described in the [OSP R
collaboration
guide](https://dev.open-systems-pharmacology.org/r-development-resources/collaboration_guide#releasing-versions).

For development versions, [this GitHub
action](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite-R/blob/main/.github/workflows/main-workflow.yaml#L11-L17)
automatically increments the `.9000` version suffix when pull requests
are merged.

# Code of Conduct

Everyone interacting in the Open Systems Pharmacology community
(codebases, issue trackers, chat rooms, mailing lists etc.) is expected
to follow the Open Systems Pharmacology [code of
conduct](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/Suite/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

# Contribution

Contributions to the Open Systems Pharmacology community are welcome.
Before contributing, read the [contribution
guidelines](https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/Suite/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
Code contributors should follow the [R coding
standards](https://dev.open-systems-pharmacology.org/r-development-resources/coding_standards_r)
and [collaboration
guide](https://dev.open-systems-pharmacology.org/r-development-resources/collaboration_guide).

# License

OSPSuite-R is released under the [GPLv2
License](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/LICENSE).

All trademarks within this document belong to their legitimate owners.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`AgingData`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/AgingData.md)
  : AgingData

- [`Application`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Application.md)
  : Application

- [`CompareBy`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/CompareBy.md)
  : How should comparison of entities be performed

- [`DataAggregationMethods`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DataAggregationMethods.md)
  : Names of aggregation available for plotPopulationTimeProfile()

- [`DataColumn`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DataColumn.md)
  : DataColumn

- [`DataCombined`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DataCombined.md)
  : Object combining simulated and observed data

- [`DataErrorType`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DataErrorType.md)
  : Supported types of the error

- [`DataImporterConfiguration`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DataImporterConfiguration.md)
  : DataImporterConfiguration

- [`DataRepository`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DataRepository.md)
  : DataRepository

- [`DataSet`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DataSet.md)
  : DataSet

- [`DefaultPlotConfiguration`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DefaultPlotConfiguration.md)
  : Plot configuration for OSP plots

- [`DotNetWrapper`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/DotNetWrapper.md)
  :

  Wrapper class for `.NET` objects

- [`Entity`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Entity.md)
  : Entity

- [`Formula`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Formula.md)
  [`TableFormula`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Formula.md)
  : Formula

- [`Gender`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Gender.md)
  : Default genders defined in PK-Sim

- [`HumanPopulation`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/HumanPopulation.md)
  : Default human population defined in PK-Sim

- [`IndividualCharacteristics`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/IndividualCharacteristics.md)
  : IndividualCharacteristics

- [`MoleculeOntogeny`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/MoleculeOntogeny.md)
  : MoleculeOntogeny

- [`MoleculeParameter`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/MoleculeParameter.md)
  : Standard molecule parameter names typically available in an
  endogenous molecule (enzyme, transporter etc...) coming from PK-Sim

- [`OutputSchema`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/OutputSchema.md)
  : OutputSchema

- [`OutputSelections`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/OutputSelections.md)
  : OutputSelections

- [`PKParameter`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/PKParameter.md)
  : PKParameter

- [`PKParameterSensitivity`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/PKParameterSensitivity.md)
  : PKParameterSensitivity

- [`Parameter`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Parameter.md)
  : Parameter

- [`ParameterRange`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/ParameterRange.md)
  : ParameterRange

- [`Population`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Population.md)
  : Population

- [`PopulationCharacteristics`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/PopulationCharacteristics.md)
  : PopulationCharacteristics

- [`Quantity`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Quantity.md)
  : Quantity

- [`QuantityPKParameter`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/QuantityPKParameter.md)
  : QuantityPKParameter

- [`QuantitySelection`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/QuantitySelection.md)
  : QuantitySelection

- [`SensitivityAnalysis`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SensitivityAnalysis.md)
  : SensitivityAnalysis

- [`SensitivityAnalysisResults`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SensitivityAnalysisResults.md)
  : SensitivityAnalysisResults

- [`SensitivityAnalysisRunOptions`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SensitivityAnalysisRunOptions.md)
  : SensitivityAnalysisRunOptions

- [`Simulation`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Simulation.md)
  : Simulation

- [`SimulationBatch`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SimulationBatch.md)
  : SimulationBatch

- [`SimulationBatchOptions`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SimulationBatchOptions.md)
  : SimulationBatchOptions

- [`SimulationBatchRunValues`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SimulationBatchRunValues.md)
  : SimulationBatchRunValues

- [`SimulationPKAnalyses`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SimulationPKAnalyses.md)
  : SimulationPKAnalyses

- [`SimulationResults`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SimulationResults.md)
  : SimulationResults

- [`SimulationRunOptions`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SimulationRunOptions.md)
  : SimulationRunOptions

- [`SimulationSettings`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SimulationSettings.md)
  : SimulationSettings

- [`SnapshotParameter`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SnapshotParameter.md)
  : SnapshotParameter

- [`SolverSettings`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/SolverSettings.md)
  : SolverSettings

- [`Species`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/Species.md)
  : Default species defined in PK-Sim

- [`StandardContainer`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/StandardContainer.md)
  : Standard containers typically available in a PBPK simulation

- [`StandardOntogeny`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/StandardOntogeny.md)
  : List of ontogeny supported in PK-Sim

- [`StandardPKParameter`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/StandardPKParameter.md)
  : Standard PK-Parameters types defined in OSPSuite This is only used
  to defined how a user defined PK Parameter should be calculated

- [`StandardPath`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/StandardPath.md)
  : Standard parameter paths typically available in a PBPK simulation

- [`UserDefinedPKParameter`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/UserDefinedPKParameter.md)
  : UserDefinedPKParameter

- [`ValuePoint`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/ValuePoint.md)
  : ValuePoint

- [`addOutputInterval()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/addOutputInterval.md)
  : Adds an interval to the output schema of the simulation

- [`addOutputs()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/addOutputs.md)
  :

  Adds the quantities as output into the `simulation`. The quantities
  can either be specified using explicit instances or using paths.

- [`addUserDefinedPKParameter()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/addUserDefinedPKParameter.md)
  : Adds and returns a User-Defined PK-Parameter to the managed list of
  PK-Parameters

- [`allAvailableDimensions()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/allAvailableDimensions.md)
  :

  List all available dimensions in the `OSPSuite` platform

- [`allPKParameterNames()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/allPKParameterNames.md)
  : Returns the name of all pk parameters defined in the system

- [`calculatePKAnalyses()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/calculatePKAnalyses.md)
  :

  Calculates the pkAnalyses for all output values available in
  `results`.

- [`calculateResiduals()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/calculateResiduals.md)
  :

  Calculate residuals for datasets in `DataCombined`

- [`clearMemory()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/clearMemory.md)
  : Clears the memory used by all underlying objects

- [`clearOutputIntervals()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/clearOutputIntervals.md)
  :

  Removes all intervals as well as all single time points from the
  output schema defined in `simulation`

- [`clearOutputs()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/clearOutputs.md)
  :

  Removes all selected output from the given `simulation`

- [`convertSnapshot()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/convertSnapshot.md)
  : Convert between snapshot and project formats

- [`convertUnits()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/convertUnits.md)
  :

  Convert datasets in `DataCombined` to common units

- [`createDistributions()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/createDistributions.md)
  :

  Creates the parameter distributions based on the given individual
  `individualCharacteristics`

- [`createImporterConfigurationForFile()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/createImporterConfigurationForFile.md)
  :

  Create a `DataImporterConfiguration` for an XLS sheet

- [`createIndividual()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/createIndividual.md)
  : Creates an individual using the PK-Sim Database

- [`createIndividualCharacteristics()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/createIndividualCharacteristics.md)
  : Creates an individual using the PK-Sim Database.

- [`createPopulation()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/createPopulation.md)
  : Creates an population using the PK-Sim Database

- [`createPopulationCharacteristics()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/createPopulationCharacteristics.md)
  : Creates the population characteristics used to create a population

- [`createSimulationBatch()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/createSimulationBatch.md)
  :

  Creates and returns an instance of a `SimulationBatch` that can be
  used to efficiently vary parameters and initial values in a simulation

- [`dataSetToDataFrame()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dataSetToDataFrame.md)
  [`dataSetToTibble()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dataSetToDataFrame.md)
  :

  Converts a list of `DataSet` objects to a data.frame

- [`.expandPath()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-expandPath.md)
  :

  Returns the expanded path for `path` and ensure that encoding is
  applied properly

- [`.gatherFiles()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-gatherFiles.md)
  : Gather files and files from folders to one location

- [`.getConcurrentSimulationRunnerResults()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-getConcurrentSimulationRunnerResults.md)
  : Get SimulationResults from ConcurrentSimulationRunner

- [`.getOspDimensions()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-getOspDimensions.md)
  : get OSP Dimensions from OSPSuite.Dimensions.xml data

- [`.getOspUnits()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-getOspUnits.md)
  : get OSP Units from OSPSuite.Dimensions.xml data

- [`.getQuantityDisplayPaths()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-getQuantityDisplayPaths.md)
  : Retrieves the display path of the quantity defined by path in the
  simulation

- [`.parameterValueListFrom()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-parameterValueListFrom.md)
  :

  Converts a list of .NET `ParameterValue` into a list with 2 entries:
  `paths`, `values`. A 3rd optional entry `units` will be defined if the
  parameter `addUnits` is set to `TRUE`. Note: Units are only available
  for .NET object of type `ParameterValueWithUnit`

- [`.parseDimensionsXML()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-parseDimensionsXML.md)
  : parse OSPSuite.Dimensions.xml containing dimensions and units

- [`.savePKAnalysesToCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-savePKAnalysesToCSV.md)
  : Saves the pK-analyses to csv file

- [`.savePopulationToCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-savePopulationToCSV.md)
  : Saves the population to csv file

- [`.saveResultsToCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-saveResultsToCSV.md)
  : Saves the simulation results to csv file

- [`.saveSensitivityAnalysisResultsToCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-saveSensitivityAnalysisResultsToCSV.md)
  : Saves the simulation analysis results to csv file

- [`.scaleQuantityValues()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-scaleQuantityValues.md)
  : Scale current values of quantities using a factor

- [`.setEndSimulationTime()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-setEndSimulationTime.md)
  : Set end time of the simulation

- [`.setQuantityValues()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-setQuantityValues.md)
  : Set values of quantity

- [`.validateHasUnit()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/dot-validateHasUnit.md)
  : Check if quantity can be represented in the unit

- [`exportIndividualSimulations()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/exportIndividualSimulations.md)
  :

  Export simulation PKMLs for given `individualIds`. Each pkml file will
  contain the original simulation updated with parameters of the
  corresponding individual.

- [`exportPKAnalysesToCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/exportPKAnalysesToCSV.md)
  : Saves the pK-analyses to csv file

- [`exportPopulationToCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/exportPopulationToCSV.md)
  : Saves the population to csv file

- [`exportResultsToCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/exportResultsToCSV.md)
  : Saves the simulation results to csv file

- [`exportSensitivityAnalysisResultsToCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/exportSensitivityAnalysisResultsToCSV.md)
  : Saves the simulation analysis results to csv file

- [`exportSteadyStateToXLS()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/exportSteadyStateToXLS.md)
  : Export steady-state to Excel in the format that can be imported in
  MoBi.

- [`getAllContainerPathsIn()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllContainerPathsIn.md)
  : Retrieves the path of all containers defined in the container and
  all its children

- [`getAllContainersMatching()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllContainersMatching.md)
  : Retrieve all sub containers of a parent container (simulation or
  container instance) matching the given path criteria

- [`getAllMoleculePathsIn()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllMoleculePathsIn.md)
  : Retrieves the paths of all molecules defined in the container and
  all its children

- [`getAllMoleculesMatching()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllMoleculesMatching.md)
  : Retrieve all molecules of a container (simulation or container
  instance) matching the given path criteria

- [`getAllObserverPathsIn()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllObserverPathsIn.md)
  : Retrieves the path of all observers defined in the container and all
  its children

- [`getAllParameterPathsIn()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllParameterPathsIn.md)
  : Retrieves the path of all parameters defined in the container and
  all its children

- [`getAllParametersForSensitivityAnalysisMatching()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllParametersForSensitivityAnalysisMatching.md)
  : Retrieve all parameters of the given simulation matching the given
  path criteria and also potential candidate for sensitivity variation

- [`getAllParametersMatching()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllParametersMatching.md)
  : Retrieve all parameters of a container (simulation or container
  instance) matching the given path criteria

- [`getAllQuantitiesMatching()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllQuantitiesMatching.md)
  : Retrieve all quantities of a container (simulation or container
  instance) matching the given path criteria

- [`getAllQuantityPathsIn()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllQuantityPathsIn.md)
  : Retrieves the path of all quantities defined in the container and
  all its children

- [`getAllStateVariableParametersPaths()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllStateVariableParametersPaths.md)
  : Get the paths of all state variable parameters of the simulation

- [`getAllStateVariablesPaths()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getAllStateVariablesPaths.md)
  : Get the paths of all state variable quantities of the simulation

- [`getBaseUnit()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getBaseUnit.md)
  : Get base unit of a dimension

- [`getContainer()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getContainer.md)
  : Retrieve a single container by path under the given container

- [`getDimensionByName()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getDimensionByName.md)
  : Get dimension by name

- [`getDimensionForUnit()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getDimensionForUnit.md)
  : Get dimension for a given unit

- [`getMolWeightFor()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getMolWeightFor.md)
  : Retrieve molecular weight for a quantity's molecule

- [`getMolecule()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getMolecule.md)
  : Retrieve a single molecule by path in the given container

- [`getOSPSuiteSetting()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getOSPSuiteSetting.md)
  : Get the value of a global ospsuite-R setting.

- [`getOutputValues()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getOutputValues.md)
  : Extracting simulated values

- [`getParameter()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getParameter.md)
  : Retrieve a single parameter by path in the given container

- [`getParameterDisplayPaths()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getParameterDisplayPaths.md)
  : Retrieves the display path of the parameters defined by paths in the
  simulation

- [`getQuantity()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getQuantity.md)
  : Retrieve a single quantity by path in the given container

- [`getQuantityValuesByPath()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getQuantityValuesByPath.md)
  : Get the values of quantities in the simulation by path

- [`getSimulationTree()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getSimulationTree.md)
  : Get simulation tree

- [`getStandardMoleculeParameters()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getStandardMoleculeParameters.md)
  :

  Returns a list containing all standard global parameters defined in a
  `simulation` for given `moleculeName`. These parameters are typically
  located directly under the container named after the `moleculeName`.
  For the list of standard parameters

- [`getSteadyState()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getSteadyState.md)
  : Get the steady-state values of species and state variable
  parameters.

- [`getUnitsForDimension()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getUnitsForDimension.md)
  : Get units for a given dimension

- [`hasDimension()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/hasDimension.md)
  : Dimension existence

- [`hasUnit()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/hasUnit.md)
  : Unit existence

- [`importPKAnalysesFromCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/importPKAnalysesFromCSV.md)
  : Loads the pK-analyses from csv file

- [`importResultsFromCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/importResultsFromCSV.md)
  : Imports the simulation results from one or more csv files

- [`importSensitivityAnalysisResultsFromCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/importSensitivityAnalysisResultsFromCSV.md)
  : Imports the simulation analysis results from one or more csv files

- [`initPKSim()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/initPKSim.md)
  :

  Loads the `PKSim.R` dll that will enable create individual and create
  population workflows.

- [`isExplicitFormulaByPath()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/isExplicitFormulaByPath.md)
  : Is the value defined by an explicit formula

- [`loadAgingDataFromCSV()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/loadAgingDataFromCSV.md)
  : Loads aging data (typically generated from PK-Sim) i

- [`loadDataImporterConfiguration()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/loadDataImporterConfiguration.md)
  :

  Load `DataImporterConfiguration` from XML file.

- [`loadDataSetFromPKML()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/loadDataSetFromPKML.md)
  :

  Loads data (typically observed data) from a PKML file and creates a
  `DataSet` from it. The pkml files are typically exported from PK-Sim
  or MoBi.

- [`loadDataSetsFromExcel()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/loadDataSetsFromExcel.md)
  : Load data sets from excel

- [`loadPopulation()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/loadPopulation.md)
  : Loads a population from a csv file and returns the population.

- [`loadSimulation()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/loadSimulation.md)
  : Load a simulation from a pkml file

- [`messages`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/messages.md)
  :

  List of functions and strings used to signal error messages Extends
  the `messages` list from ospsuite.utils

- [`ospDimensions`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/ospDimensions.md)
  : Supported dimensions defined as a named list

- [`ospUnits`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/ospUnits.md)
  : Supported units defined as a named list of lists

- [`ospsuiteSettingNames`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/ospsuiteSettingNames.md)
  :

  Names of the settings stored in ospsuiteEnv. Can be used with
  [`getOSPSuiteSetting()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/getOSPSuiteSetting.md)

- [`pkAnalysesAsDataFrame()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/ospsuite_deprecated.md)
  [`populationAsDataFrame()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/ospsuite_deprecated.md)
  : Deprecated functions

- [`pkAnalysesToDataFrame()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/pkAnalysesToDataFrame.md)
  [`pkAnalysesToTibble()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/pkAnalysesToDataFrame.md)
  : Convert the pk-Analysis to data frame

- [`pkParameterByName()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/pkParameterByName.md)
  : Returns an instance of a PK-Parameter by name or NULL if the
  parameter by name is not found

- [`plotIndividualTimeProfile()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/plotIndividualTimeProfile.md)
  : Time-profile plot of individual data

- [`plotObservedVsSimulated()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/plotObservedVsSimulated.md)
  : Observed versus predicted/simulated scatter plot

- [`plotPopulationTimeProfile()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/plotPopulationTimeProfile.md)
  : Time-values profile plot for population simulations

- [`plotResidualsVsSimulated()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/plotResidualsVsSimulated.md)
  : Residuals versus time scatter plot

- [`plotResidualsVsTime()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/plotResidualsVsTime.md)
  : Residuals versus time scatter plot

- [`populationToDataFrame()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/populationToDataFrame.md)
  [`populationToTibble()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/populationToDataFrame.md)
  : Creates a data.frame containing one column for each parameter
  defined in the population

- [`potentialVariableParameterPathsFor()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/potentialVariableParameterPathsFor.md)
  : Returns an array of parameter path with one entry for each parameter
  that is used in the simulation and can potentially be used for
  sensitivity analysis

- [`removeAllUserDefinedPKParameters()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/removeAllUserDefinedPKParameters.md)
  : Removes all User-Defined PK-Parameters that may have been added to
  the system

- [`removeSimulationFromCache()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/removeSimulationFromCache.md)
  : Removes a simulation from simulations cache.

- [`resetSimulationCache()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/resetSimulationCache.md)
  : Clears cache of loaded simulations

- [`runSensitivityAnalysis()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/runSensitivityAnalysis.md)
  : Runs a sensitivity analysis

- [`runSimulationBatches()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/runSimulationBatches.md)
  : Run simulation batches

- [`runSimulations()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/runSimulations.md)
  : Runs multiple simulations concurrently.

- [`runSimulationsFromSnapshot()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/runSimulationsFromSnapshot.md)
  : Run Simulations From Snapshot Files

- [`saveDataSetToPKML()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/saveDataSetToPKML.md)
  :

  Save the `DataSet` to pkml

- [`saveSimulation()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/saveSimulation.md)
  : Saves a simulation to pkml file

- [`scaleParameterValues()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/scaleParameterValues.md)
  : Scale current values of parameters using a factor

- [`setMoleculeInitialValues()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/setMoleculeInitialValues.md)
  : Set molecule start values

- [`setMoleculeScaleDivisors()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/setMoleculeScaleDivisors.md)
  : Set molecule scale divisors

- [`setMoleculeValuesByPath()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/setMoleculeValuesByPath.md)
  : Set molecule start values in the simulation by path

- [`setOutputInterval()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/setOutputInterval.md)
  : Clears the output interval from the simulation and adds a new one.

- [`setOutputs()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/setOutputs.md)
  : Set outputs

- [`setParameterValues()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/setParameterValues.md)
  : Set values of parameters

- [`setParameterValuesByPath()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/setParameterValuesByPath.md)
  : Set the values of parameters in the simulation by path

- [`setQuantityValuesByPath()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/setQuantityValuesByPath.md)
  : Set the values of quantities in the simulation by path

- [`simulationResultsToDataFrame()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/simulationResultsToDataFrame.md)
  [`simulationResultsToTibble()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/simulationResultsToDataFrame.md)
  :

  Converts a `SimulationResults` objects to a data.frame

- [`splitPopulationFile()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/splitPopulationFile.md)
  :

  Loads a population from the `csvPopulationFile` and split the loaded
  population according to `numberOfCores`.

- [`toBaseUnit()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/toBaseUnit.md)
  : Converts a value given in a specified unit into the base unit of a
  quantity

- [`toDisplayUnit()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/toDisplayUnit.md)
  : Convert base unit to display unit

- [`toPathArray()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/toPathArray.md)
  : Convert a path defined as string to a path array

- [`toPathString()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/toPathString.md)
  : Convert a path array to a path as string with entries separated by
  '\|'

- [`toUnit()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/toUnit.md)
  : Converts a value given in base unit of a quantity into a target unit

- [`uniqueEntities()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/uniqueEntities.md)
  : Extract Unique Elements of type 'Entity'

- [`updatePKParameter()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/updatePKParameter.md)
  : Updates some properties of a PK-Parameter (displayName and
  displayUnit)

- [`validateDimension()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/validateDimension.md)
  : Validate dimension

- [`validateUnit()`](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/reference/validateUnit.md)
  : Validate unit

### Primary functions

  entities](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/load-get.md):

  values](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/set-values.md):

  simulation](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/run-simulation.md):
- [Calculating PK parameters of simulation
  outputs](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/pk-analysis.md):
- [Sensitivity
  analysis](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/sensitivity-analysis.md):
- [Creating
  individuals](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/create-individual.md):
- [Population
  simulations](https://www.open-systems-pharmacology.org/OSPSuite-R/articles/create-run-population.md):
